item.title: Vim Tip: Delete All Lines That Match A Pattern
item.dc:creator: josephscott
item.description: The basic approach to deleting all lines that match a pattern in Vim is very simple: [sourcecode] :g/[pattern]/d [/sourcecode] If you want to do more, you can switch modes. Here is how you would delete all the lines matching a pattern, along with the line below each match: [sourcecode] :g/[pattern]/normal 2dd [/sourcecode]
item.content:encoded:
The basic approach to deleting all lines that match a pattern in Vim is very simple:

[sourcecode]
:g/[pattern]/d
[/sourcecode]

If you want to do more, you can switch modes. Here is how you would delete all the lines matching a pattern, along with the line below each match:

[sourcecode]
:g/[pattern]/normal 2dd
[/sourcecode]

item.title: Tip: Christmas Box Staging Area
item.dc:creator: josephscott
item.description: Yesterday we packed up the Christmas decorations. This involves three general steps: Bring out the empty boxes from storage Pack the boxes with Christmas decorations Put the filled boxes back into storage The problem with these steps is that we always manage to forget a few items, which requires bringing back out all of the […]
item.content:encoded:
Yesterday we packed up the Christmas decorations. This involves three general steps:

  • Bring out the empty boxes from storage
  • Pack the boxes with Christmas decorations
  • Put the filled boxes back into storage

The problem with these steps is that we always manage to forget a few items, which requires bringing back out all of the boxes.

This year I’ve finally learned my lesson and adjusted the steps above to incorporate a staging area for the boxes:

  • Bring out the empty boxes from storage
  • Pack the boxes with Christmas decorations
  • Stack the boxes up in a corner of the room
  • Wait for a day or two
  • Put the filled boxes back into storage

Wish I’d thought of this sooner.

item.title: Free Shipping Supplies
item.dc:creator: josephscott
item.description: From the random tips file. The USPS ( United States Postal Service ) will send you Free Shipping Supplies. Pro tip, some of these include several boxes in each pack. One example, this one, has 25 boxes per pack.
item.content:encoded:
From the random tips file. The USPS ( United States Postal Service ) will send you Free Shipping Supplies.

Pro tip, some of these include several boxes in each pack. One example, this one, has 25 boxes per pack.
